docs.snippet: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., Wednesday, April 19 -- The Soviet Union proposed last night that the General Assembly request all members of the United Nations to provide the "necessary assistance," if requested by Cuba, to repulse the "aggression" there.
docs.lead_paragraph: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., Wednesday, April 19 -- The Soviet Union proposed last night that the General Assembly request all members of the United Nations to provide the "necessary assistance," if requested by Cuba, to repulse the "aggression" there.

headline.main: SOVIET URGES U.N. TO ASSIST CASTRO; Calls for Action to Disarm Cuban Rebels in U.S. Soviet Urges U.N. Assistance to Castro Regime if Requested DISARMING ASKED OF UNITS ABROAD Resolution Would Condemn 'Aggressive Acts of U.S.' and Other Nations

byline.original: By THOMAS J. HAMILTON Special to The New York Times

docs.snippet: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., April 18 -- Italy was elected today a member of the United Nations Economic and Social Council, breaking a deadlock that had existed since the General Assembly met last December to fill the vacancies.
docs.lead_paragraph: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., April 18 -- Italy was elected today a member of the United Nations Economic and Social Council, breaking a deadlock that had existed since the General Assembly met last December to fill the vacancies.
docs.abstract: Italy elected after Belgium and India withdraw with understanding Asian-African bloc will get 2 seats in fall election

headline.main: ITALY WINS A SEAT ON SOCIAL COUNCIL; Election by U.N. Assembly Ends Long Deadlock

byline.original: By LINDESAY PARROTT Special to The New York Times

docs.snippet: To coordinate soc security laws with those of Italy to aid immigrants

docs.snippet: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., April 19 -- Britain and Canada announced today their support of a Latin-American proposal under which the General Assembly would ask members of the Organization of American States to help settle the dispute between the United...
docs.lead_paragraph: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., April 19 -- Britain and Canada announced today their support of a Latin-American proposal under which the General Assembly would ask members of the Organization of American States to help settle the dispute between the United States and Cuba.

headline.main: Britain and Canada Support Latin Plan in U.N. for O.A.S. Action on Cuban Crisis; REGIONAL NATURE OF RIFT STRESSED Resolution, Urging Mediation to End Dispute With U.S., Expected to Be Adopted

byline.original: By THOMAS J. HAMILTON Special to The New York Times
Special to The New York Times

docs.snippet: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., April 20 -- A majority of the Latin-American nations voted in the Budget Committee tonight against an emergency Asian-African plan to finance the military operation in the Congo.
docs.lead_paragraph: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., April 20 -- A majority of the Latin-American nations voted in the Budget Committee tonight against an emergency Asian-African plan to finance the military operation in the Congo.

headline.main: CONGO FUND PLAN BALKED BY LATINS
